timeline.message:
[opensprinkler] Add current draw channel

The opensprinkler device, if it has a sensor for it, can display the
current draw of the device. This information is exposed as a read-only
channel with this commit.

Fixes #6386

Signed-off-by: Florian <florian.schmidt.welzow@t-online.de>

Replace whitespace with tabs

Signed-off-by: Florian <florian.schmidt.welzow@t-online.de>

timeline.body: Exceptions should have "Exception" as their suffix, but I also think that you could give this a more generic name, like "MissingSensorException".
timeline.bodyText: Exceptions should have "Exception" as their suffix, but I also think that you could give this a more generic name, like "MissingSensorException".
timeline.bodyHTML: Exceptions should have "Exception" as their suffix, but I also think that you could give this a more generic name, like "MissingSensorException".
timeline.author: cpmeister
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,22 @@
+/**
+ * Copyright (c) 2010-2020 Contributors to the openHAB project
+ *
+ * See the NOTICE file(s) distributed with this work for additional
+ * information.
+ *
+ * This program and the accompanying materials are made available under the
+ * terms of the Eclipse Public License 2.0 which is available at
+ * http://www.eclipse.org/legal/epl-2.0
+ *
+ * SPDX-License-Identifier: EPL-2.0
+ */
+package org.openhab.binding.opensprinkler.internal.model;
+
+/**
+ * Indicates, that a device is missing a sensor to measure the current draw of itself.
+ *
+ * @author Florian Schmidt - Initial contribution
+ */
+public class NoCurrentDrawSensor extends Exception {

replies.bodyText:
Why should it have "Exception" as a suffix. The name already indicates, that's something exceptional, and it extends Exception, so it's pretty clear, that it's an exception, sin't it? What else should it be? However, if you say so, I'll add exception at the end.
Why should the name more generic? The only usage of the exception is, when no sensor for measuring the current draw is present. If it's more generic, the exception probably doesn't transport the intention anymore, isn't it? :/
replies.author: FlorianSW

replies.bodyText:
Well the xxxException is the naming convention that we follow. Also I suggested that it could be more generic but NoCurrentDrawSensorException works just fine as well. I was only suggesting something more generic in case there are other sensors that may also be detected missing so that they can reuse that custom exception.
But once again all I want is to have the name changed to match our naming conventions.
replies.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: Understood :) The Exception prefix is added with the last commit. I would change the name to a more generic exception, once we need to have a more generic one. At the moment, there is no other sensor we might miss :)
replies.author: FlorianSW

timeline.message:
Comply with naming convention of exceptions

Signed-off-by: Florian <florian.schmidt.welzow@t-online.de>

timeline.body: Please move this logic to line 86, just before you would need to use it. No reason to create this variable without knowing if you need it or not.

timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.body: Is the current sensor something that can be added or removed in realtime or is it something intrinsic to the device itself? If it can't be changed in realtime it would be better to add the channel during handler initialization so it gets executed only once rather than every time channel values are updated.
timeline.bodyText: Is the current sensor something that can be added or removed in realtime or is it something intrinsic to the device itself? If it can't be changed in realtime it would be better to add the channel during handler initialization so it gets executed only once rather than every time channel values are updated.

replies.bodyText: It looks like the design pattern you are using is rather common in other bindings, so disregard this change request.
replies.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: Where? IMO this needs to be changed. Thing updates should only be done if the thing really needs chaning. I think in this case it should be done in initialize().
replies.author: J-N-K

timeline.message:
Register channel in initialize

Signed-off-by: Florian <florian.schmidt.welzow@t-online.de>

timeline.bodyHTML:
Since you never remove the channel, you could move this to the most upper level.

if (thing.getChannel == null) {
   try {
       getApi.currentDraw();

       ThingBuilder thingBuilder = editThing();
       Channel currentDrawChannel = ...
       thingBuilder.withChannel(currentDrawChannel);
       updateThing(thingBuilder.build());
   } catch (...) {
      logger.debug(...);
   }
}
timeline.author: J-N-K
